text:
-   Ultrasound exam: A procedure in which high-energy sound waves (ultrasound) are bounced off internal tissues or organs, such as the kidney, and make echoes. The echoes form a picture of body tissues called a sonogram. The picture can be printed to be looked at later. This procedure is done to check for tumors that may also have formed in the kidney.",CancerGov,Childhood Central Nervous System Atypical Teratoid/Rhabdoid Tumor
what research (or clinical trials) is being done for Childho
